Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent of the "massive cuts" in Social Security that Republicans Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan support.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to prove that Republicans support "massive cuts" in Social Security.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Republican budget proposal approved by the U.S. House in early 2012 includes "massive" cuts to Social Security, but it is not clear if this is the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or interpretations of the Republican budget proposal that do not support the claim of "massive cuts" in Social Security.
